intro: Geraniospermum minimum, commonly known as the dwarf geranium, is a small, perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of South Africa. It typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, with compact, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces vibrant flowers in shades of red, pink, and purple, which bloom throughout the warmer months. It is well adapted to drought conditions, storing water in its succulent tissues. Geraniospermum minimum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its striking appearance and resilience.
